labels.label: A process group serves to group a set of similarly-used processes in order to cause less processors to clutter the canvas
This processor allows data in the body of the FlowFile to be inserted as an attribute of the FlowFile.
This processor demonstrates the use of inserting an attribute into the content of its FlowFile based on the name of the attribute

This processor enables data to be appended to, prepended to, removed from the content of a FlowFile. It can also replace data. --------------------------------------------------------- All of these options are based on a regular expression used to signal what to edit or where in the content of the FlowFile to edit. -------------------------------------------------------- Text can also be 'hard-coded' into the FlowFile
This processor allows some FlowFile to be sent back as a response
This template shows how one might use a retry loop

This processor enables data to be appended to, prepended to, removed from the content of a FlowFile. It can also replace data. ------------------------------------------- All of these options are based on a regular expression used to signal what to edit or where in the content of the FlowFile to edit.

processGroups.comments:
This flow will track how many times a given flow file routes through it. If the number of times exceeds a specific maximum then it will route to the 'limit exceeded' port. Otherwise it will route to 'retry'.
The attributes it uses are 'retry.counter' and 'retry.maxcount'. If the 'retry.maxcount' is specified on a given flowfile then it will be honored. Otherwise a default of '3' is set as the maximum retry count.
As the flowfile goes through this flow it increments the 'retry.maxcount' attribute by 1. It then checks if this value exceeds 'retry.maxcount' and if so then it routes the flowfile to 'limit exceeded' otherwise it routes to 'retry'.
So you can configure the 'retry' relationship to loop back to the process you want and you can send the 'limit exceeded' to move on from that process to something else.

outputPorts.comments: Items sent to this port have not yet exceeded the maximum retry count.
outputPorts.name: retry

processGroups.name: Retry Check Loop

entry.value: Your counter value is not less than three (3)!
